snippet: In a statement, Senator Robert Menendez denied speculation that he was holding up an Obama administration nomination for a judgeship because of “some petty political vendetta.”
abstract: Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey denies accusations that there are personal reasons behind his decision to block a Judiciary Committee hearing for Federal Judge Patty Shwartz, nominated by Pres Obama to the US Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit; Menendez, the first Democrat to hold up one of the Obama administration's judicial nominees, says that Shwartz simply does not demonstrate an adequate breadth of knowledge of constitutional law.
lead_paragraph: In a statement, Senator Robert Menendez denied speculation that he was holding up an Obama administration nomination for a judgeship because of “some petty political vendetta.”

headline.seo: Senator Robert Menendez, in Statement, Airs Concerns With Judge Patty Shwartz
headline.main: Senator Says His Concerns With Nominee Aren’t Personal
headline.print_headline: Senator Says His Concerns With Nominee Aren’t Personal
